content.description: Clip the first 2 bolts of Birthday Boy, then head right up the ramp to the obvious large flake.  From the top of the flake, cast off up the face on well-spaced but good holds, with a crux encounter moving left past a positive crimp.  Clip one more bolt of Birthday Boy and finish at new anchors.

Slab to steep corner, back to slab, then up a slightly overhanging headwall. A little dirty still but quite fun. Watch out for the "butt crack" feature up high, it tends to eat ropes.

Best to have a follower clean the route, to avoid getting your rope stuck, and due to the slightly wandering nature of the route.

Neo-classic that features scoops, pockets, and flakes on impeccable white and grey limestone.

Start on 3 bolts of slightly overhanging jugs, hit a small ledge, then launch up the slabby and technical upper section, which is pretty sustained at 5.10+/5.11-.  The crux comes at the second-to-last bolt, making a long move past a jug rail to a textured scoop.
content.location: Far right side of Visionary Buttress.

content.description: Desperate overhanging seam to much easier upper face.  Long-time project that was recently redpointed by a Humboldt local, Nic Sabo. Listed in the Bigfoot guide as "Grounded Visionary" project.
content.location: Center of the west face of the Visionary Buttress. Look for the weird ring bolts.

content.description:
Start in an unprotected but moderate left-facing corner, heading directly up to an incipient crack system.  From the first gear placements, head left past a couple of overlaps to a much more prominent crack that widens from tips to fists at the top.

Could use a proper cleaning but takes relatively good gear, as limestone gear goes.
content.location: Middle-right of Visionary Buttress, look for a left-facing corner to short crack about 20' up.

content.description: Climb vertical seam then step right to steep face. Joins Obliquity at the 6th bolt. Crux is pulling off the ledge between the 6th and 7th bolts of Obliquity.
Left arete of the Visionary Buttress. Climbs the arete most of the way, but busts onto the face for the last couple of bolts.  Crux up high.

Climb the face, step left to the arete for a few bolts, then move back right up high. Finish at new anchors on the face or continue left past a couple more bolts to the Obliquity/Hold Your Fire/Happy Whateva anchors.
content.location: On the right arete of the buttress, just right of the very steep first half of "Obliquity".

content.description: Excellent climbing with a few cruxes broken by a few rests.  First obvious crux comes pulling onto a slab over a small bulge, and the second comes making a long reach up high off an incut right-hand crimp.  Finish at Marco Paulo anchors.
